avalancheActivity.highlights: Freeze thaw cycles recently have made the snow pack stable in most places.

snowpackStructure.highlights: The snow has melted considerably in warm weather and rain earlier this week. Thin layer of new snow came last weekend but it rained again so the snow pack is considered stable in most places. Ongoing warm weather and snow is expected to settle even more. A small amount of new snow might be addend in the highest elevations.

travelAdvisory.comment: Melt-freeze cycles last week have stabilized the snow in most places. Small wind slabs could be present at high elevations in the northern part of the country.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Melt-freeze cycles last week have stabilized the snow in most places. Small wind slabs could be present at high elevations in the northern part of the country.

weatherForecast.highlights: S-A-áttir og dálitlar skúrir en gæti snjóað lítillega í hæstu fjöll. Hiti um og yfir frostmarki til fjalla.

avalancheActivity.comment: Small avalanches released in Þorfinnur on Monday.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Snow has widely settled after rain over the weekend and is widely considered stable.

snowpackStructure.highlights: It rained at high elevations on Sunday and Monday and some snow has melted in many places. Small slabs could be present at high elevations on N-NE aspects. Mainly dry in the next few days and frost at high elevations.

travelAdvisory.comment: Melt-freeze cycles last week have stabilized the snow in most places. Small wind slabs could be present at high elevations in the northern part of the country.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Melt-freeze cycles last week have stabilized the snow in most places. Small wind slabs could be present at high elevations in the northern part of the country.

weatherForecast.highlights: Austlægar áttir næstu daga og úrkomulítið. Yfirleitt frost til fjalla en við frostmark við sjávarmál.

avalancheActivity.highlights: Snow and firn considered generally stable after thaw and wet weather and warm temperatures in high elevations.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Temperatures have been above freezing point in mountain elevation and the snow is considered stable and the snow surface is hard in most places.

travelAdvisory.comment: Melt-freeze cycles last week have stabilized the snow in most places. Small wind slabs could be present at high elevations in the northern part of the country.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Melt-freeze cycles last week have stabilized the snow in most places. Small wind slabs could be present at high elevations in the northern part of the country.

weatherForecast.highlights: Tíðindalítið veður næstu þrjá daga, kólnar og mögulega lítilsháttar él á föstudagskvöld.

avalancheActivity.highlights: The snowpack is considered mostly stable after freeze-thaw cycles. Small wind slabs could form on westerly aspects on Thursday and Friday.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Freeze-thaw cycles have made the snow isothermal and the snow pack is considered stable in most places. Some snowfall in the next few days, especially on Thursday and Friday. Small wind slabs could form on westerly aspects.

travelAdvisory.comment: Melt-freeze cycles last week have stabilized the snow in most places. Small wind slabs could be present at high elevations in the northern part of the country.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Melt-freeze cycles last week have stabilized the snow in most places. Small wind slabs could be present at high elevations in the northern part of the country.

weatherForecast.highlights: Austlægar eða breytilegar áttir og dálítil él eða snjókoma. Hiti um frostmark á láglendi en frost til fjalla.
